Detailed Description

RGB Frame class. This class represent a POB-EYE frame.

  • First call the init() method to initialize the pobeye frame.

  • To get a frame from the camera, call one of these methods :
    1. grab(),
    2. grabRedFrame(),
    3. grabGreenFrame() or
    4. grabBlueFrame().

  • Next, binary the frame (with the binary() method ) and identify forms with the identify() methods.

  • There are various utils methods, for example get a pixel frame with the methods :
    1. gray() and getGray(),
    2. getRedPixel(),
    3. getGreenPixel() or
    4. getBluePixel().

Note:
The frame is in POB-EYE memory. The memory contains the 3 components red,green and blue. This memory has a size of ~ 32 Kbytes ( 120 pixels per 88 per component ).
Warning:
The POB-EYE module have 64 Kbytes of RAM and uses 32 Kbytes for his own usage. You have for your program only 32 Kbytes .
Author:
Baptiste Burles. POB-Technology
